sentences.en: Collines had exposed the fallacy of modern aesthetics to me.
sentences.cn: 科林斯曾经向我揭示过现代美学的谬误.

sentences.en: Facts once again give the lie to the fallacy.
sentences.cn: 事实再一次揭穿了这一谎言.

sentences.en: Had it not been exposed long ago as a fallacy?
sentences.cn: 不是早已揭露过这是一种谬论 吗 ?

sentences.en: He had no difficulty in disposing of the fallacy.
sentences.cn: 他毫无困难地驳倒了这个谬论.

sentences.en: His blunders of interpretation are due to what has been described as the " pathetic fallacy ".
sentences.cn: 他在解释事物方面之所以每每出错,是由于人们所说的那种 “ 感情的误置 ”.

sentences.en: It exposes the fallacy of short-term industrial gain at long-term environmental expense.
sentences.cn: 这暴露了以长久的环境破坏为代价换取短期工业利益的错误。

sentences.en: It is a fallacy to say that the camera never lies.
sentences.cn: 说照相机绝不骗人，这是谬见。

sentences.en: It is a fallacy to suppose that riches always bring happiness.
sentences.cn: 认为财富总能带来幸福是一种错误的见解.

sentences.en: It is a popular fallacy to suppose that riches always bring happiness.
sentences.cn: 假定财富永远带来幸福是常有的谬见.

sentences.en: It's a fallacy that the affluent give relatively more to charity than the less prosperous.
sentences.cn: 富人比穷人对慈善事业的捐助更多些；这种观点是一种谬见。

sentences.en: It's a fallacy to suppose that wealth brings happiness.
sentences.cn: 认为财富能带来幸福,这是一种错误的见解.

sentences.en: It's a popular fallacy that success always brings happiness.
sentences.cn: 认为成功总是带来幸福是一种普遍的谬见.

sentences.en: It’s a common fallacy that a neutered dog will become fat and lazy.
sentences.cn: 说阉割过的狗会变得又胖又懒，这是普遍的谬见。

sentences.en: No, that is the great fallacy; the wisdom of old men.
sentences.cn: 不, 这是个大谬论; 说什么老人有智慧.

sentences.en: The fallacy has been exposed in its naked absurdity.
sentences.cn: 这谬论的荒诞性已被充分揭露.

sentences.en: The other day , I wrote about the danger of the sunk - cost fallacy.
sentences.cn: 我曾经写到过沉没成本谬论的危险性.

words.tran_cn: 谬误的；骗人的；靠不住的；不合理的

trans.tran_en: a false idea or belief, especially one that a lot of people believe is true
